channel.title: Combine Destiny 2
channel.description:
[url='combinedestiny.com']Combine Destiny 2[/url] just released a bunch of new media after a two-year hiatus. There's also a [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUoxQzRjC40&playnext_from=TL&videos=mOEjqfLMDyk&feature=sub']new video[/url] showing some beautifully animated hand signals and combine soldier arms.
SO, what do you think?

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Kisuke_Moto
item.description:
Now that I play it again, it was actually combine like. But the whole story about it was bit trash.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Why? You just have to run like crazy down a narrow canyon with a dozen fast zombies on your heels until you reach a dropship. Apparently they thought you valuable enough to send half a dozen elites to rescue you and your squadmates.

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Android11x:

Is someone bringing all this to their [the devs’] attention?

Yes. Everything that was wrong with the mod, that you are all needlessly describing here, has already been addressed on the CD2 forums, and the devs are usually already aware of them.

Just go check out the forums. There’s just the slightest trickle of activity, but there’s plenty of old threads to learn about the mod.

I still really want to know what the GIG (a new grenade of some sort) is. I’m betting one of the G’s stands for gravity.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I don’t really see the difference from playing as a Private in Call of Duty, a Corporal in Opposing Force, a scientist in Half-Life, etc. It’s a normal guy who gets a lot done.

And there’s a reason to make radio chat informal. Sure, it breaks a little immersion but I would honestly get tired fast of over-formalized quotes like
“Necrotics infested two gateways down, dispense jurisdiction code ten.” or COD-style:
“We have a visual on two-fox-niner, danger close. Requesting an a-sat to light up that signal.”

Like the others, I’m reserving judgement for when I see it. I do remember the first one being kind of okay, but I have actually seen some mods playing as Civil Protection that manage a much more interesting story, and even some good characters.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
I played the first one, it was alright.

I think they should have made you a Combine Elite though, to differentiate you from all the other Combine Soldiers that are under your command and who die, meanwhile you cut a path through everything.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
It wasn’t just three guys, it was just that you were one of a few teams sent in the reactivate the facility; they didn’t know it was infested. I do agree with radio chat being too human, though.

Guys, pretty much everything you’ve been complaining about in the original has been addressed by the devs, so stop whining and focus on the sequel, which is what this thread was made for.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
Played the first combine destiny and really didn’t enjoyed it, the friendly IA was really buggy and the story made no sense at all. Why would the combine sent just 3 guys in a mission like that? Plus the radio chat with the commander felt too human and informal.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Pyro:

I liked how the levels were laid out, thought they could have been prettier, and better paced.

I know I nit-pick a lot, but their maps are just full of level design flaws that I don’t think I could be dumb enough to leave in, and I don’t even map.

I think I should do a video walk-through-review of the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Dias:

the level design
the story
the lack of atmosphere
the level design
the pacing
the level design
the scripted sequences
the level design
& did I forget to mention the level design?

I liked how the levels were laid out, thought they could have been prettier, and better paced. The atmosphere was pretty good, just not the professional subliminal mind control, messing-with-your-head stuff you’ll expect in a Valve game.

lambda:

Nice mod, but i still wonder when…

You gonna finish that sentence?

Read full topic

item.title: Combine Destiny 2
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
The main thing I didn’t like was that you spent 90% of the time on your own fighting zombies with regular weapons, which was dull and didn’t really sell the idea that you were a Combine soldier.
